lines: Are you sure you can afford it?
Definitely!
Aaron serves dinner to Daphne and DAPHNE’S PARENTS.
More Italian tofu and chianti pasta?
Well, that is exciting.
Thanks, Mrs. Binks.  It is thrilling.
Intern, not a secretary.
Intern?  Like Monica Lewinsky?  You gonna be taking out any dry cleaning?  I’m just kidding.
If you want to get into the music biz you start as an intern.
You don’t have to be so dismissive of it, dad.
You should see the sculptures she’s doing.  She’s got some great projects up her sleeve.
I’m just worried that a creative and an intern living together -- who’s the support beam?  Judging by this neighborhood you’re barely holding on as is.
First of all, this place is not cheap.  Downtown’s coming back.
From what?  Armageddon?
I don’t make much but I make enough for the two of us.
What happens when you lose your job because the music industry is downsizing because no one buys records anymore?
I guess I’ll just have to resort to my previous work -- male escort.
Aaron’s awkwardly sitting in silence with Daphne’s dad in the living room.
How’s the corporate law these days?
It’s a job.  Aaron, I just wanted to say something to you.  I can see how much you care for my daughter.
I do, sir.  Very much.  Honestly, and I know, I’m young, but I hope to one day marry her.
Don’t call me sir.
I called you sir?
Yeah.
I didn’t even notice.
Well, you did.
I’m... sorry?
I just wanted to tell you that I think you two are making a terrible mistake moving in together.
What?  Why?
You two are not ready at all.
Yeah we are.
No you aren’t.
I believe we are.
I believe you aren’t.
I love her.
No you don’t.
Yes I do.
No you don’t.
I do.  I do love her too.
You just don’t.
You don’t and they aren’t.  You’re not right for her.  She’s a flighty girl.  She needs someone more grounded.
She’s an amazing sculptor.  It just takes a while to break into the art world.
I’m not going to debate my daughter’s future with you.  She’s a cute girl who needs to land a rich husband before she pops out a few grand kids and ends up teaching art in an elementary school.
I think she’s talented.

The world has too much talent and not enough customers.  Here’s the deal: quit playing house like a little girl.  You’re in the music biz.  Go out, party like a rock star, experiment with drugs, go apeshit crazy so you don’t end up doing it later in life.  Move in with a couple best male friends and live it up.  Now’s the time.
I already live with my best friend.  Daphne’s my best friend.
What if my dad’s right?  What if I have no talent?
First of all, he said you had talent.  He just said there’s not enough customers.  Which there are, by the way.  Forget I mentioned it.
Maybe this is all just shit shit shit and shit.  I just want to break it all and start over again.
Are you kidding?  This is so super pretty.
REVEAL they’re discussing a sculpture of a bloody, screaming woman holding a bloody, screaming baby.  It’s more terrifying than pretty.  She definitely has talent, a dark weird talent.
Did you use glaze?
Yeah.  He’s right.  My career’s going nowhere.  I suck.
Let’s make a game plan.  Rent a gallery downtown.  Advertise the show in LA Weekly.  Maybe do some guerrilla marketing stuff.  We’ll just get this done.
The point isn’t the show, Aaron.  It’s not that easy.  Trying to do something creative is just different than what you do.  It’s not a linear process.  No offense.
You’re not being a bitch.
I was being a bitch.  You can be mad at me.
I’m not mad at you.

I love that you’re nice.  You’re the first nice guy I’ve ever dated and I love that about you.  But when I’m being a bitch and you don’t say I’m being a bitch you’re keeping a part of yourself closed off from me.  Feel free to be honest and tell me when you’re annoyed at me.
Daphne smiles at this.
And as for getting your career off the ground, just make a list of what needs doing.  That’s how I get stuff done.
You here for a meeting?
I’m here to start working.  I’m the new intern.
Aaron pulls back in, big smile on his face.
Me again.  Couldn’t find parking.
May I help you?
Andrea Laken...
Whatcha drinking, Andrea?
Caramel latte... who are you?
Well, Andrea, I’m Aaron Greenberg, your future intern.
So, Mr. Greenberg, who’s your favorite composer?
I love Amadeus.  So passionate.
He sees the receptionist.
Sup, Andrea.
Where are you going?
Roma wants his latte.  I know.  You’d think he could get it himself.  Oh, and here’s a caramel latte for you.  Got an extra one.  Whatcha gonna do?
What is this?  Who are you?
Sergio, what is up?
Aaron holds out his hand.  Sergio looks at it for an uncomfortably long amount of time.
I’m Aaron Greenberg, your new A&R guy.
I’m Aaron Greenberg, your new A&R guy.
Columbia Records Vancouver?
Yeah, we got a small outfit over there.  Nothing like this.
I don’t remember hiring you.
Well, you’re a busy guy --
Take Aaron.  I always like to chat with my new guys before they start up here.  Who’s your idol?  Like, who do you hope to be in thirty years.
David Geffen.  He’s the king.  I hope to be him in every way, except, not, you know...
What is that?  Lifestyle like how?
Like I’m not gay.
I am.
That’s crazy.  I’m actually gay as well.
You just said you weren’t.
I know, I just didn’t know how you’d respond or whatever.  It’s so nice to be working for a fellow gay guy.  Are you out because I’ve read almost everything about you --
Don’t you worry about that.  How long have you known you were gay?
I realized when I was ten or thirteen.  I would play sports with the guys and I realized I didn’t just want to play sports with them.  I wanted to kiss them on the  mouth.
Oh, yeah.  I remember that.  So are you in a relationship now?
Not anyone specifically.  I’ll make out with four strangers in a night.
Not anyone specifically.  I’ll make out with four strangers in a night.

Like last night I was at this gay bar and I had sex with this guy who looked exactly like Ryan Gosling, probably was him if you know what I mean, and, well, I’ll probably never see him again.  How about you?  What bars do you frequent?
I’ve been with the same man for two decades.
Does it look like I give a fuck?
Honestly no.
-- Aaron appears in the doorway holding a tray of cookies.
Anyone up for a homemade cookie?
Anyone up for a homemade cookie?
Get the fuck out of here.  But leave the cookies.
OK.
Aaron walks in.  Daphne watches Grey’s Anatomy with several girlfriends who wave at Aaron.
You started Grey’s without me!?
Aaron and the girls all watch Grey’s together.
I just don’t think McDreamy is as cool as people think.  He’s hot but he’s not like a great guy.
Yeah, he is.  He just doesn’t know what he wants.
See, I disagree with that.  He’s really selfish; it’s just disguised as not knowing what he wants.  I’m sorry, I am just not on the McDreamy train.  Now, Dr. O’Malley.  Hello!
Check this out.  It says that the number one sex secret for men is licking his butt.  Isn’t that hilarious?
Totally.
You wouldn’t ever want me to do that?
No.  Of course not.
They laugh some more.  Awkward pause.  Then Aaron kisses Daphne.
Good night.
He’s wanted in Sardinia for attempted manslaughter.  Or at least that’s what I read on gawker.
Sergio sits across from Aaron who’s pitching his heart out.
Yeah.
Fully loaded?
What?  Sure... why?
You think I want a fucking car salesman dealing with a rock star?
Yeah, I think you do.

My girl has your plane tickets.  I want him here safe and sound two days before the show.  Get him on the plane, get him in the car and get him to his suite at the Four Seasons.  Do not take a detour.  If you so much as stop by the side of the road for a fucking burger I will personally see that your career in the music biz is over.
He’s a vegetarian.
It takes people years to get to a place like this.  You’re aware of that, right?
I’ve been waiting my whole life for this kind of opportunity.
You have any questions about Mr. Snow?  You sure you can handle him?
Yes.  It’s my belief that everyone in their heart of hearts is kind.
What a wonderful notion.  Well, let’s just say that around Aldous Snow’s kind heart is an eternal plane of dark evil shit.
Understood.
Aaron runs in.  Daphne is reading a magazine.
Guess who’s going to hang out with Aldous Snow, baby?
What accent is that?
English.
Aaron is about to get into the limo.
Actually, sure.
Aaron’s in the backseat.  The limo driver’s driving.  There’s at least an acre of space between Aaron and the limo driver.  Aaron’s in heaven.
So you must pick up lots of famous people?
Beat.
Are these Diet Cokes free?

Aaron takes a Diet Coke.  He then takes a glass out of the cabinet and tries to pour it into the glass so as to use all the limo accoutrements.  They hit a pothole and he spills the Diet Coke everywhere.  He looks at the driver who doesn’t seem to have noticed.  He starts to pour again and the driver STOPS SHORT.  He spills the rest of the Coke all over himself.  He gingerly places the cup back into the cupholder.
You mind if I put the divider up?
There is no divider.
Sweet.
Aaron sits down in first class.  He can’t believe how nice it is.  A FLIGHT ATTENDANT WALKS BY.
I’m actually on the clock, Veronica, but... what the hell.  You only live once.
Aaron stands outside, getting his courage to hit the buzzer.   *He finally HITS it.  A dude OPENS the door.  *
Sup? I’m Aaron Greenberg with Pinnacle --
Aaron walks into the Aldous’s apartment.  Aldous’s hanging out with the a bunch of super cool, English Guys.
Sup? I’m Aaron Greenberg with Pinnacle --
Right.  You’re meant to accompany me on my trip to LA.  Make sure I don’t go all bonkers.
It’s super lame, I know.
The guys all laugh.  Then out of the laughter, we here Aaron say...
Been there.
You have?  What happened?
I just used to really do the junk like all the time.  Like everyday.
I just used to really do the junk like all the time.  Like everyday.
I used to smoke it.  And eat it.  I used to eat junk with a spoon.
Specifically.
One time I was on the road, teen tour, and me and my junk buddies -- we were like super into junk at the time.  Like you know that movie Trainspotting?
They all nod.

We were like that.  Well we ran out of junk so we stole a car, like a Porsche style car, and we went down to Mehico to buy more junk and the border guy said “you guys got heroin in your car!”  And I swear at that moment I became a man.
How’d you respond?  When the border guard said that?
“No I don’t have heroin in my car!”  But we did.  We had a lot of junk in the car.  Every one of us did.
That is something.
It was something.  It was.
Lena hugs Aldous and kisses him on the lips.  She then hugs *Aaron and Aaron awkwardly and accidentally kisses Lena on the  *lips.  No one seems to notice.  Aaron leans into the car.*
Heathrow, British Airways terminal.
Who are you?
Aaron Greenberg from Pinnacle --
Where are you going?  Aren’t you going to sit back here with me?  I’ll be lonely without you.
Oh, yeah.  Of course.
Captain Knob’s a good one.  But that Abby’s got him all turned around.
Totally.  It’s like...
I’m glad they sent me someone who’s experienced.  With the controlled substances.
Too often non drug addicted people just don’t understand, like at all.
I’ve been a little busy.  Putting the finishing touches on my new album.
You recording your new album?
Not yet at the recording stage.  Still conceptualizationing.  But like in my brain, it’s like done, you know?  How long have you been working at Pinnacle?
Yeah.
So, how long you’ve been with her?
Three years.
You live with her?
Has it been easy?  Hard?
Well there are certainly challenges.
Do you get along with her parents?
Her dad can be a challenge, but I think he respects me and what I’m about.
If I listened to what my dad said, I’d be all messed up in my head.
Are you in touch with him these days?  I mean, you don’t have to say --
What’s your type?  Like your perfect woman?
My girlfriend.
Besides her, like if it couldn’t be her.  Like if she died or left you or something.
Like a doctor.  I really think doctors are super cool.
Looks?
Well I guess blond and petite except for around here.
Around her tits?  Or including her tits?
Including them.  But this is a really theoretical proposition --
Parents married or divorced?
Divorced.  You sure are inquisitive.  It’s like you’re collecting evidence!
That’s a shame.  Who’s fault?
Everyone’s!  So, why perform now?
Funny, right?  My life, it’s humorous.  I like you.  Do you like me?
You won’t ever betray me?
Dude, I am like the most trustworthy guy ever.
Aaron’s on his cell phone.  SPLIT SCREEN with Sergio who runs  **on a treadmill incredibly fast without sweating or even really breathing hard.*
We’re in line at Heathrow and are about to get on the flight.  He actually seems pretty together and cool.
Aldous and Aaron are standing in line.  Aaron is talking and smiling while Aldous is starting to look a bit uneasy.
I can’t believe I was only in London for like four hours.  I so want to come back for like a real amount of time.  It seems like a really neat city.
Shove this up your bum.
What?  Why’re you whispering, buddy?  You got a secret?
Stop acting all mental and let me shove this heroin up your ass already.  I thought you used to run heroin all the time.
I did, it’s just been like eight years so I’m not exactly...
Is it up there?
Yes.
No part of it is sticking out of your anal cavity?
No.  Definitely not.  Do these things burst?
You’re welcome.  Well all cleaned up now.  No vomiting anymore.
What’s up?  It must be crazy doing security.  You must have a lot of stories.
I guess I have a few.
I mean, are you like always suspicious of every single person you see?
Not really.  Most people are good blokes.

Cause I’d be all the time thinking like that “guy over there has a bomb” or “that women over there has a bunch of drugs in her purse and a bomb.”  Cause I think that anyway and I’m not even in your line of work.  Anyway, good to meet you.
Aaron and Aldous sit in the first class club.  Aldous is leafing through NME magazine.  Aaron’s trying not to hyperventilate.
Morally I probably shouldn’t be doing this.
Morally you should.
You’re supposed to be clean.  I’m an enabler.  I’m enabling right now.
A year before you quit you pick a quit date.  If I quit before my quit date my whole AA plan goes out the window.
I thought when you quit you just quit.

If I don’t do heroin this week I’ll jump the gun on my quit date, which I picked over a year aqo and have been mentally preparing for ever since, then my inability to quit once and for all will be on your conscience.  Do you want that on your conscience?
No.  This thing is going to burst.  I feel it’s already burst.
If it had burst you’d know.  Believe me.
What’s that supposed to mean?
Drink it down.
No.
Drink it down.  It’ll help loosen the sphincter.  Ironically a loose sphincter aids anal control.
Oh, cool, that’s really interesting.
Aldous grabs the drink and brings it up to Aaron’s lips.  Aaron drinks it down.
I’m just going to see if our flight’s on time.
Aaron’s at the desk, talking to the female Club Attendant.
I just wanted to confirm that flight 51 to LA is on time.
Aldous tosses a bundle of cash on the table.
I don’t think we should do that necessarily.  We’re supposed to head to LA.  You know, for your big performance at the Greek.  That’s why we’re here.
Hello, again, Mr. Greenberg.  Did you enjoy your stay in London?
Yes.
Baby you shouldn’t have!  You’re only away for one night!
Didn’t want anyone stealing you away.
Aaron decides whether to lie.
Great.  Really great.
What’s Aldous like?
Super cool.  Like couldn’t be a better guy.
Really?  Cause from afar he seems like he’d be totally crazy.
No.  Not crazy at all.  Really mellow and cool actually.
No.  Not crazy at all.  Really mellow and cool actually.
Funnily enough, turns out we’re going to New York instead of LA first so I’m probably not going to be home for another night.
That sucks.  Why the change?
Totally planned.  Turns out he needs to do some press stuff in New York first.
You really have no stories?  He didn’t say or do anything funny?
Nope.  Pretty straight laced, good guy.
You’re using your lying voice.
I’d be lying if I said anything interesting happened.
I don’t want to find out he’s been making you do crazy stuff like smuggling a bong on the plane and you’ve been too scared to tell me.
That’s hilarious.  I love you and your hilarity.
Aldous pulls out an adrenaline needle.
Like from Pulp Fiction?
No.  Like from life.  Got it?
Yeah, sure.
The Fasten Seat Belt Light flips off.
I’ve gotta go to the bathroom.
You are not taking a shit.
I have to go like right now.
The seatbelt sign BINGS off.
Guess who just had a little bit of sex with the flight attendant?
Oh.  Awes.
What’s going on in there, friend?
Nothing.
You better not be taking a shit.  That’s my property.
I’m aware.  I’m not.  Just doing number one.
Aaron opens the door.
Everything’s fine.
Prove it to me.
I can’t prove it to you without expelling it.
So...
So I’m not going to do that right now.  Perhaps when we land and you need it.
It was wrong of me to make you stash it up your bum.  That was not right.
At the very least you should have warned me before we were in the security line.
I understand why you expelled it.  It’s scary having that much dope so close to one’s intestinal track.
Thank you for understanding.
Aldous starts digging around in the toilet.
I wouldn’t do that.  Seriously, let’s just go back to our seats.  I’m sure we can figure this out once we get to New York.  They have H in New York, right?  Please, Aldous --
Get in there!
I’m afraid!  I heard that this woman was sitting on the toilet and hit the flusher and it sucked out her intestines!  I do not want that to happen to me.
Aldous HITS the flusher and Aaron’s hand gets sucked and stuck partially in the toilet.
AHHHH!!!
AHHHH!!!
It’s stuck!  My hand’s stuck!  Why’d you do that?!?!
Take a breath!  You’re healthy!  I’m healthy!  We’re both alive and excited to be alive!  Now what do you feel?
I don’t know.
I don’t know.
I feel some metal.  And something slimy.  And...and... I feel a balloon!  I feel the balloon!
This is fantastic!  Are you fingers around it?
Almost... yes!
Almost... yes!
I can’t, it’s stuck!
Aldous grabs Aaron’s arm and YANKS IT out of the toilet.
AHHHHH!
Against all odds, you did it!  I’m proud of you.
Thanks.  Thank you.
Aldous hugs Aaron.
Here’s your property.
It’s a photo Aldous took of him having sex with the flight attendant.
You just did that?
Aaron and Aldous get in the car.
Manny’s Guitar shop, at --
Actually, Four Seasons, midtown.
We shouldn’t stay over in New York.
Aaron’s on his cell while washing the drug balloon.
Two first class one ways from New York to LA.  Whatever airline leaves first.  I don’t care.
His phone beeps.  Aaron looks at it.  Shit.  SPLIT SCREEN with Sergio who’s having brunch in a beautiful outdoor cafe with ten FASHIONABLE, WEALTHY-SEEMING GUYS.
One sec.  I got a call on the other line.
Where are you?  The car service is at LAX and there’s no you.
Our plane got grounded.
No, it didn’t.
If it didn’t then how am I still sitting in Heathrow?
Then why does the computer say that it landed in LA and why did my driver see an entire plane load of people from your flight getting their bags?
What’s the flight number?
Flight 543 --
What was that?
Heathrow police.
I’m not happy about this.
And neither am I.
That’ll be 4123.53 per ticket.
Alrighty then.  It’s a Mastercard.
Aaron, look, a lot of people would have walked away then.  I think a stronger person would stay through this.  And that person is you.

I’m fine, Aldous.  This is really par for the course for me.  I had to do a very similar thing when I assisted Mylie Cyrus at the Kids Choice Awards.  She’s not allowed soda and I got her some.  Not up my butt, but same difference really.
Daphne is very lucky.  Does Daphne know how lucky she is?
I don’t know.

I think she does.  Look, after putting you through what I just put you through, I don’t think I could ever do anything that bad again.  I don’t like myself when I’m like that.  But the drugs take hold and well, you know the story.
Totally.  Story as old as time.  Why don’t you just quit today and give the story a happy ending?  Carpe Deum, know what I mean.
And well you might ask.  And well you might ask.  I feel the fates brought us together.  I see myself when I was your age.
Really?  Thank you.

Aldous heads into the room.  Aaron looks out at the view.  It’s a pretty amazing view.  He smiles again.  This is rock star living no matter if you had to have a balloon of heroin up your ass to achieve it.  He sees the balloon on the table.  He touches it.  He holds it in his hand and squeezes it.  He squeezes it again.  He starts absentmindedly squeezing it like a stress ball while looking out at the view.
New York City.
Suddenly POP.  Powder heroin everywhere.
Oh, boy.
Aaron stands, panicked.  He looks up and sees a napkin inside.  He runs inside and runs back out with the napkin.  A flock of pigeons descend and start eating the heroin.
No!  Shoo!  No!  Don’t eat that!  You do not want to eat that!
Aaron and Aldous are in a car service in a particularly seedy section of New York.  A group of homeless men are talking around a garbage can.
I am willing to pay you for the H, but I am not a drug buying guy.  Besides, we should really get to Manny’s and then get to LA --
Money don’t mean nothing to me.  Just things.  And drugs.
If you want it, why don’t you buy it?
Because I’m famous.  I could get in trouble for this shit.  Now go out there and make pappa proud.
You shouldn’t be doing this stuff.
Too many to count.
I was lying before.  I’ve never bought or sold heroin.  I’ve never even seen it until now.
I was lying before.  I’ve never bought or sold heroin.  I’ve never even seen it until now.
Really.
You think I give a shit what kind of heroin buying experience you have?  Oh, I only want a lad who majored in drug purchasing at Oxford buying my drugs.
I’m not trying to eff off --
I guess that’s why Daphne’s dad hates you.  And right he should.
Firstly, he doesn’t hate me --
But I know your type.  You are a vampire, sucking the life out of others so that you can live.
I’m not a vampire.  I’m a good guy.   It’s all my fault, it really is, everything that’s happened, but buying illegal drugs is --
Aaron walks towards the trash can.  He turns to see the limo drive away, Aldous giving him a thumbs up.  Aaron joins the group of guys around the garbage can.
The Homeless Guy walks away.
Alright, that’s cool.
You looking for a package?
Maybe.  Who’s asking?
What the fuck, man?  Do you want to buy some heroin or not?
Yes.
Toss your thousand in the garbage can.  Go down that alley.  A man will meet you down there.
Toss my money down there?  I’ve got a better idea, why don’t I just give you my ATM code?  My social security number?
Toss my money down there?  I’ve got a better idea, why don’t I just give you my ATM code?  My social security number?
Since there’s so much trust flowing back and forth, I’ll give you a go with my girlfriend.  You know, while we’re at it.
The Scumbag wanders away.  Aaron looks around and then tosses the cash in the garbage can.  He looks at the alley.
Mother effer.
Hey, baby.  What’s going on?
I just wanted to tell you, sweetie, how much I love you.  Like love love you.
Me too.
No, like, I love love you.
I love love you too.  Are you crying?  Cause you crying is going to make me cry.
What if I never saw you again?  I don’t know what I’d do with myself.
It’s so good to hear you open up and be emotional.  So often I feel like the needy one in our relationship.
You’re not needy -- you’re perfect.  Where are you anyway?
You’re not needy -- you’re perfect.  Where are you anyway?
I love the Banana Republic.  I love you forever.
He gets to the end of the alley.  Suddenly the same Scumbag comes out of the shadows.  He’s dressed slightly differently.
Gotta go.
You Aaron?
We just met, ese.
You don’t know me, bitch.  Do you know me?
No.  Not at all.  Except from five minutes ago, ese.
He holds his hand out.  Aaron shakes it.
Aaron.
What you pay?
I got a two bedroom, one bath, 2500 a month.

I pay twice that for a studio that looks out at a ventilator shaft.  Good location though.  I gotta move to LA.  I have this screenplay idea about the drug war but it’s from the like POV of the drug guy on the street, you know?  But the drug guy has these like X-men powers and shit.  I’d tell you more but you might steal the idea and then I’d have to fucking kill you.
Totally.  So we doing this or what?  Cause time unlike money doesn’t grow on trees.
Gritty opens his mouth and points to the package which is in his mouth.
What?  Just hand it to me like a man, ese.
There are cops everywhere.  Open your mouth up to receive the package.
I’m not doing that.
I was harsh, but that’s because life is challenging and this is one of those challenges.
It’s fine.  I got it done.  That’s what I do.  I get things done and this is one of those things.
Or rather it’s for your great love, Daphne.
Is this real diamond?  Cause if it is this is not necessary at all.  This is probably the most expensive thing I own.
Aldous leaves.  Aaron looks at the diamonds.
Wow.
Give me five minutes, mate.  Just five.  Five alive.
Of course.
The Reaper hasn’t got me yet.  This is my best American friend, Aaron Greenberg.
Good to meet you.
Aaron pulls Aldous out of the shop.  The limo pulls up.  The Limo Driver gets out and Aldous jumps in.  Phil comes out.
I just want you to know that Aldous feels terrible about what he’s done.
Course we are, man.
We’re just figuring out the damage.  Bill.
That guy’s a dick, he’s always been a dick.
I’m superbummed you got caught up in this whole thing.
Phil PUNCHES Aaron in the face.
Why do that, man?
Great seeing you, Aldous.  And nice meeting you, Aaron.
The pleasure was all mine.
I don’t think I could even do anything that bad again.
Hey, you know what, you’ve gotta go through your artistic process.
When the worst possible thing has already happened, it could not possibly get worse and therefore it’ll just be an uphill trajectory from here on out.
Whatever, it’s fine, man.  Really.
Do you ever curse?  Because now is a moment where you are well within your rights to curse.
Sure I do.
Say the word fuck.
Like in what context?
Like, shut the fuck up.
Shut the fuck up.
And calm the fuck down you crazy motherfucking fucker.
Why?  Why bother saying that really, you know?  Like why?
Cause I want you to.  Say it.  Say it, puppet, say it.
